+ $diffFiles = git diff --name-status upstream/main...main
+ 
+ if ($diffFiles) {
+     Write-Host &quot;  Changed files:&quot; -ForegroundColor White
+     $diffFiles | ForEach-Object {
+         $status = $_.Substring(0, 1)
+         $file = $_.Substring(2)
+         $color = switch ($status) {
+             &quot;A&quot; { &quot;Green&quot; }  # Added
+             &quot;M&quot; { &quot;Yellow&quot; } # Modified
+             &quot;D&quot; { &quot;Red&quot; }    # Deleted
+             default { &quot;White&quot; }
+         }
+         $symbol = switch ($status) {
+             &quot;A&quot; { &quot;+&quot; }
+             &quot;M&quot; { &quot;~&quot; }
+             &quot;D&quot; { &quot;-&quot; }
+             default { &quot;?&quot; }
+         }
+         Write-Host &quot;    [$symbol] $file&quot; -ForegroundColor $color
+     }
+     
+     $fileCount = ($diffFiles | Measure-Object).Count
+     Write-Host &quot;&#96;n  Total: $fileCount files&quot; -ForegroundColor White
+ } else {
+     Write-Host &quot;  No file differences&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ }

+ 
+ # Check if merge would create conflicts
+ $conflicts = git merge-tree $(git merge-base upstream/main main) upstream/main main | Select-String &quot;^changed in both&quot;
+ 
+ if ($conflicts) {
+     Write-Host &quot;  âš ï¸  Potential conflicts detected:&quot; -ForegroundColor Red

+ Write-Host &quot;  Status: &quot; -NoNewline

+ //! Natural language command parser
+ //! 
+ //! Converts natural language input to slash commands and CLI subcommands.
+ //! Supports Japanese and English.
+ 
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ 
+ /// Natural language patterns for slash commands
+ pub struct NaturalLanguageParser {
+     /// Mapping from natural language patterns to slash commands
+     patterns: HashMap&lt;&amp;&#39;static str, Vec&lt;&amp;&#39;static str&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl NaturalLanguageParser {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         let mut patterns = HashMap::new();
+         
+         // /compact patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;compact&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;åœ§ç¸®&quot;, &quot;è¦ç´„&quot;, &quot;ã¾ã¨ã‚&quot;, &quot;çŸ­ã&quot;, &quot;ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¯ãƒˆ&quot;,
+             &quot;compress&quot;, &quot;compact&quot;, &quot;summarize&quot;, &quot;shorten&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /review patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;review&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼&quot;, &quot;ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯&quot;, &quot;ç¢ºèª&quot;, &quot;è¦‹ã¦&quot;, &quot;æ¤œè¨¼&quot;,
+             &quot;review&quot;, &quot;check&quot;, &quot;verify&quot;, &quot;inspect&quot;, &quot;examine&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /delegate patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;delegate&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;å§”è­²&quot;, &quot;ä¾é ¼&quot;, &quot;é ¼ã‚€&quot;, &quot;ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆã«&quot;, &quot;ã‚µãƒ–ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆ&quot;,
+             &quot;delegate&quot;, &quot;assign&quot;, &quot;request&quot;, &quot;agent&quot;, &quot;subagent&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /research patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;research&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;èª¿æŸ»&quot;, &quot;ç ”ç©¶&quot;, &quot;ãƒªã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ&quot;, &quot;èª¿ã¹ã¦&quot;, &quot;æ¤œç´¢&quot;,
+             &quot;research&quot;, &quot;investigate&quot;, &quot;study&quot;, &quot;search&quot;, &quot;explore&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /orchestrate patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;orchestrate&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚±ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³&quot;, &quot;ä¸¦åˆ—å®Ÿè¡Œ&quot;, &quot;è¤‡æ•°ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆ&quot;, &quot;çµ±åˆ¶&quot;,
+             &quot;orchestrate&quot;, &quot;parallel&quot;, &quot;multiple agents&quot;, &quot;coordinate&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /plan patterns (formerly /blueprint)
+         patterns.insert(&quot;plan&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;è¨ˆç”»&quot;, &quot;ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³&quot;, &quot;è¨­è¨ˆ&quot;, &quot;ä¼ç”»&quot;, &quot;ãƒ–ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ãƒªãƒ³ãƒˆ&quot;,
+             &quot;plan&quot;, &quot;blueprint&quot;, &quot;design&quot;, &quot;scheme&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /new patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;new&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;æ–°è¦&quot;, &quot;æ–°ã—ã„&quot;, &quot;æ–°è¦ä½œæˆ&quot;, &quot;ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒˆ&quot;,
+             &quot;new&quot;, &quot;start&quot;, &quot;fresh&quot;, &quot;begin&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /diff patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;diff&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;å·®åˆ†&quot;, &quot;å¤‰æ›´&quot;, &quot;é•ã„&quot;, &quot;æ¯”è¼ƒ&quot;,
+             &quot;diff&quot;, &quot;difference&quot;, &quot;changes&quot;, &quot;compare&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         // /status patterns
+         patterns.insert(&quot;status&quot;, vec![
+             &quot;çŠ¶æ…‹&quot;, &quot;ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹&quot;, &quot;ç¾åœ¨ã®&quot;, &quot;æƒ…å ±&quot;,
+             &quot;status&quot;, &quot;state&quot;, &quot;info&quot;, &quot;current&quot;,
+         ]);
+         
+         Self { patterns }
+     }
+     
+     /// Parse natural language input to slash command
+     /// 
+     /// Returns (command_name, remaining_text) if matched, None otherwise
+     pub fn parse_to_slash_command(&amp;self, input: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;(&amp;&#39;static str, String)&gt; {
+         let input_lower = input.to_lowercase();
+         
+         for (command, keywords) in &amp;self.patterns {
+             for keyword in keywords {
+                 if input_lower.starts_with(keyword) {
+                     // Extract remaining text after the keyword
+                     let remaining = input[keyword.len()..].trim().to_string();
+                     return Some((command, remaining));
+                 }
+                 
+                 // Check if keyword appears within the first few words
+                 let words: Vec&lt;&amp;str&gt; = input_lower.split_whitespace().take(3).collect();
+                 if words.iter().any(|w| w.contains(keyword)) {
+                     // Try to extract the main content after the command phrase
+                     let remaining = input.trim().to_string();
+                     return Some((command, remaining));
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         None
+     }
+     
+     /// Parse natural language input to CLI subcommand
+     /// 
+     /// Returns (subcommand, args) if matched, None otherwise
+     pub fn parse_to_cli_subcommand(&amp;self, input: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;(String, Vec&lt;String&gt;)&gt; {
+         let input_lower = input.to_lowercase();
+         
+         // Check for delegate patterns
+         if self.contains_any_keyword(&amp;input_lower, &amp;[&quot;å§”è­²&quot;, &quot;ä¾é ¼&quot;, &quot;delegate&quot;, &quot;ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆã«&quot;]) {
+             // Extract agent name and goal
+             // Example: &quot;ãƒªã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼ã«ä¾é ¼ã—ã¦Reactã‚’èª¿æŸ»&quot;
+             // â†’ (&quot;delegate&quot;, [&quot;researcher&quot;, &quot;Reactã‚’èª¿æŸ»&quot;])
+             
+             if let Some(agent_name) = self.extract_agent_name(&amp;input) {
+                 let goal = self.extract_goal(&amp;input, &amp;agent_name);
+                 return Some((&quot;delegate&quot;.to_string(), vec![agent_name, goal]));
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Check for research patterns
+         if self.contains_any_keyword(&amp;input_lower, &amp;[&quot;èª¿æŸ»&quot;, &quot;ç ”ç©¶&quot;, &quot;ãƒªã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ&quot;, &quot;research&quot;]) {
+             // Extract research topic
+             let topic = input.trim().to_string();
+             return Some((&quot;research&quot;.to_string(), vec![topic]));
+         }
+         
+         // Check for plan/blueprint patterns
+         if self.contains_any_keyword(&amp;input_lower, &amp;[&quot;è¨ˆç”»&quot;, &quot;ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒ³&quot;, &quot;plan&quot;, &quot;blueprint&quot;]) {
+             let description = input.trim().to_string();
+             return Some((&quot;plan&quot;.to_string(), vec![&quot;create&quot;.to_string(), description]));
+         }
+         
+         None
+     }
+     
+     fn contains_any_keyword(&amp;self, text: &amp;str, keywords: &amp;[&amp;str]) -&gt; bool {
+         keywords.iter().any(|kw| text.contains(kw))
+     }
+     
+     fn extract_agent_name(&amp;self, input: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+         // Common agent names
+         let agents = vec![
+             (&quot;researcher&quot;, vec![&quot;ãƒªã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¼&quot;, &quot;ç ”ç©¶è€…&quot;, &quot;researcher&quot;]),
+             (&quot;code-reviewer&quot;, vec![&quot;ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¢ãƒ¼&quot;, &quot;ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼&quot;, &quot;code-reviewer&quot;, &quot;reviewer&quot;]),
+             (&quot;test-gen&quot;, vec![&quot;ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ&quot;, &quot;test-gen&quot;, &quot;test&quot;, &quot;testing&quot;]),
+             (&quot;sec-audit&quot;, vec![&quot;ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£&quot;, &quot;ç›£æŸ»&quot;, &quot;sec-audit&quot;, &quot;security&quot;]),
+         ];
+         
+         let input_lower = input.to_lowercase();
+         for (agent_name, keywords) in agents {
+             if keywords.iter().any(|kw| input_lower.contains(kw)) {
+                 return Some(agent_name.to_string());
+             }
+         }
+         
+         None
+     }
+     
+     fn extract_goal(&amp;self, input: &amp;str, _agent_name: &amp;str) -&gt; String {
+         // Simple extraction: remove the delegation phrase and agent name
+         let input_lower = input.to_lowercase();
+         
+         // Find the start of the actual goal/task
+         if let Some(pos) = input_lower.find(&quot;ã—ã¦&quot;) {
+             return input[pos + &quot;ã—ã¦&quot;.len()..].trim().to_string();
+         }
+         if let Some(pos) = input_lower.find(&quot; to &quot;) {
+             return input[pos + &quot; to &quot;.len()..].trim().to_string();
+         }
+         
+         // Fallback: return original input
+         input.trim().to_string()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Default for NaturalLanguageParser {
+     fn default() -&gt; Self {
+         Self::new()
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {

+     #[test]
+     fn test_parse_compact_japanese() {

+         let result = parser.parse_to_slash_command(&quot;åœ§ç¸®ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„&quot;);
+         assert_eq!(result.map(|(cmd, _)| cmd), Some(&quot;compact&quot;));
+     }

+     }

+ // CyberpunkBackground.tsx - Neon Grid Background with Scanline Effect
+ import { useEffect, useRef } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ export const CyberpunkBackground = () =&gt; {
+   const canvasRef = useRef&lt;HTMLCanvasElement&gt;(null)
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const canvas = canvasRef.current
+     if (!canvas) return
+     
+     const ctx = canvas.getContext(&#39;2d&#39;)
+     if (!ctx) return
+     
+     // Set canvas size
+     const resizeCanvas = () =&gt; {
+       canvas.width = window.innerWidth
+       canvas.height = window.innerHeight
+     }
+     resizeCanvas()
+     window.addEventListener(&#39;resize&#39;, resizeCanvas)
+     
+     // Draw animated grid
+     let animationFrame: number
+     let offset = 0
+     
+     const drawGrid = () =&gt; {
+       ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height)
+       
+       const gridSize = 50
+       offset = (offset + 0.5) % gridSize
+       
+       // Draw vertical lines
+       ctx.strokeStyle = &#39;rgba(0, 212, 255, 0.15)&#39;
+       ctx.lineWidth = 1
+       
+       for (let x = -offset; x &lt; canvas.width + gridSize; x += gridSize) {
+         ctx.beginPath()
+         ctx.moveTo(x, 0)
+         ctx.lineTo(x, canvas.height)
+         ctx.stroke()
+       }
+       
+       // Draw horizontal lines
+       ctx.strokeStyle = &#39;rgba(184, 79, 255, 0.15)&#39;
+       for (let y = -offset; y &lt; canvas.height + gridSize; y += gridSize) {
+         ctx.beginPath()
+         ctx.moveTo(0, y)
+         ctx.lineTo(canvas.width, y)
+         ctx.stroke()
+       }
+       
+       // Draw glowing intersections
+       ctx.fillStyle = &#39;rgba(0, 212, 255, 0.3)&#39;
+       for (let x = -offset; x &lt; canvas.width + gridSize; x += gridSize * 2) {
+         for (let y = -offset; y &lt; canvas.height + gridSize; y += gridSize * 2) {
+           ctx.beginPath()
+           ctx.arc(x, y, 2, 0, Math.PI * 2)
+           ctx.fill()
+         }
+       }
+       
+       animationFrame = requestAnimationFrame(drawGrid)
+     }
+     
+     drawGrid()
+     
+     return () =&gt; {
+       cancelAnimationFrame(animationFrame)
+       window.removeEventListener(&#39;resize&#39;, resizeCanvas)
+     }
+   }, [])
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;cyber-grid-bg&quot; /&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;cyber-scanline&quot; /&gt;
+       &lt;canvas 
+         ref={canvasRef}
+         style={{
+           position: &#39;fixed&#39;,
+           top: 0,
+           left: 0,
+           width: &#39;100%&#39;,
+           height: &#39;100%&#39;,
+           zIndex: -2,
+           opacity: 0.4,
+           pointerEvents: &#39;none&#39;,
+         }}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
```

+ // ContextMenu.tsx - Cyberpunk-styled Context Menu
+ import { useEffect, useRef } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ export interface ContextMenuItem {
+   label: string
+   icon?: React.ReactNode
+   onClick: () =&gt; void
+   disabled?: boolean
+   divider?: boolean
+ }
+ 
+ interface ContextMenuProps {
+   x: number
+   y: number
+   items: ContextMenuItem[]
+   onClose: () =&gt; void
+ }
+ 
+ export const ContextMenu = ({ x, y, items, onClose }: ContextMenuProps) =&gt; {
+   const menuRef = useRef&lt;HTMLDivElement&gt;(null)
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const handleClickOutside = (event: MouseEvent) =&gt; {
+       if (menuRef.current &amp;&amp; !menuRef.current.contains(event.target as Node)) {
+         onClose()
+       }
+     }
+     
+     const handleEscape = (event: KeyboardEvent) =&gt; {
+       if (event.key === &#39;Escape&#39;) {
+         onClose()
+       }
+     }
+     
+     document.addEventListener(&#39;mousedown&#39;, handleClickOutside)
+     document.addEventListener(&#39;keydown&#39;, handleEscape)
+     
+     return () =&gt; {
+       document.removeEventListener(&#39;mousedown&#39;, handleClickOutside)
+       document.removeEventListener(&#39;keydown&#39;, handleEscape)
+     }
+   }, [onClose])
+   
+   // Ensure menu stays within viewport
+   const adjustedX = Math.min(x, window.innerWidth - 220)
+   const adjustedY = Math.min(y, window.innerHeight - (items.length * 40 + 20))
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;div 
+       ref={menuRef}
+       className=&quot;cyberpunk-context-menu&quot;
+       style={{
+         left: &#96;${adjustedX}px&#96;,
+         top: &#96;${adjustedY}px&#96;,
+       }}
+     &gt;
+       {items.map((item, index) =&gt; (
+         &lt;div key={index}&gt;
+           {item.divider ? (
+             &lt;div className=&quot;cyberpunk-divider&quot; style={{ margin: &#39;0.5rem 0&#39; }} /&gt;
+           ) : (
+             &lt;button
+               className={&#96;cyberpunk-menu-item ${item.disabled ? &#39;disabled&#39; : &#39;&#39;}&#96;}
+               onClick={() =&gt; {
+                 if (!item.disabled) {
+                   item.onClick()
+                   onClose()
+                 }
+               }}
+               disabled={item.disabled}
+             &gt;
+               {item.icon &amp;&amp; &lt;span className=&quot;menu-icon&quot;&gt;{item.icon}&lt;/span&gt;}
+               &lt;span className=&quot;menu-label&quot;&gt;{item.label}&lt;/span&gt;
+             &lt;/button&gt;
+           )}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       ))}
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Hook for managing context menu state
+ export const useContextMenu = () =&gt; {
+   const [contextMenu, setContextMenu] = useState&lt;{
+     x: number
+     y: number
+     items: ContextMenuItem[]
+   } | null&gt;(null)
+   
+   const showContextMenu = (x: number, y: number, items: ContextMenuItem[]) =&gt; {
+     setContextMenu({ x, y, items })
+   }
+   
+   const hideContextMenu = () =&gt; {
+     setContextMenu(null)
+   }
+   
+   const handleContextMenu = (e: React.MouseEvent, items: ContextMenuItem[]) =&gt; {
+     e.preventDefault()
+     showContextMenu(e.clientX, e.clientY, items)
+   }
+   
+   return {
+     contextMenu,
+     showContextMenu,
+     hideContextMenu,
+     handleContextMenu,
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Fix: Add missing import
+ import { useState } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
```

+     $Percent = [math]::Round(($Current / $Total) * 100)
+     $BarLength = 50
+     $FilledLength = [math]::Round(($Percent / 100) * $BarLength)
+     
+     $Bar = &quot;&quot;
+     for ($i = 0; $i -lt $FilledLength; $i++) {
+         if ($i % 2 -eq 0) {
+             $Bar += &quot;â–ˆ&quot;
+         } else {
+             $Bar += &quot;â–“&quot;
+         }
+     }
+     for ($i = $FilledLength; $i -lt $BarLength; $i++) {
+         $Bar += &quot;â–‘&quot;
+     }
+     
+     Write-Host -NoNewline &quot;&#96;r$Color[$Bar]$Reset $Percent% | $Task&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ # Build targets
+ $targets = @(
+     @{Name=&quot;codex-core&quot;; Color=$ElectricBlue},
+     @{Name=&quot;codex-cli&quot;; Color=$NeonPurple},
+     @{Name=&quot;codex-tui&quot;; Color=$HotPink},
+     @{Name=&quot;codex-tauri-gui&quot;; Color=$AcidGreen}
+ )
+ 
+ $startTime = Get-Date
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;${ElectricBlue}[PHASE 1]${Reset} Checking for changes...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
+ # Detect changed crates
+ $changedCrates = @()
+ $gitStatus = git status --short
+ 
+ if ($gitStatus -match &quot;codex-rs/core/&quot;) {
+     $changedCrates += &quot;codex-core&quot;
+ }
+ if ($gitStatus -match &quot;codex-rs/cli/&quot;) {
+     $changedCrates += &quot;codex-cli&quot;
+ }
+ if ($gitStatus -match &quot;codex-rs/tui/&quot;) {
+     $changedCrates += &quot;codex-tui&quot;
+ }
+ if ($gitStatus -match &quot;codex-rs/tauri-gui/&quot;) {
+     $changedCrates += &quot;codex-tauri-gui&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ if ($changedCrates.Count -eq 0) {
+     Write-Host &quot;${AcidGreen}âœ“${Reset} No changes detected - using full build&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     $changedCrates = @(&quot;codex-cli&quot;) # Default to CLI only
+ } else {
+     Write-Host &quot;${AcidGreen}âœ“${Reset} Detected changes in: $($changedCrates -join &#39;, &#39;)&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;${NeonPurple}[PHASE 2]${Reset} Building Rust crates (differential)...&quot; -ForegroundColor Magenta
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
+ $totalSteps = $changedCrates.Count
+ $currentStep = 0
+ 
+ foreach ($crate in $changedCrates) {
+     $currentStep++
+     $target = $targets | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $crate }
+     $color = if ($target) { $target.Color } else { $ElectricBlue }
+     
+     Write-Host &quot;${color}[BUILD $currentStep/$totalSteps]${Reset} $crate&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     
+     # Simulate progress (cargo doesn&#39;t provide real-time progress)
+     $buildSteps = @(&quot;Compiling&quot;, &quot;Linking&quot;, &quot;Optimizing&quot;, &quot;Finishing&quot;)
+     for ($i = 0; $i -lt $buildSteps.Length; $i++) {
+         Show-CyberpunkProgress -Current ($i + 1) -Total $buildSteps.Length -Task &quot;$crate - $($buildSteps[$i])&quot; -Color $color
+         Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 300
+     }
+     
+     # Actual build
+     Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+     $buildCmd = &quot;cargo build --release -p $crate&quot;
+     Write-Host &quot;  ${CyberYellow}â–¶${Reset} $buildCmd&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     
+     $buildOutput = &amp; cargo build --release -p $crate 2&gt;&amp;1
+     
+     if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
+         Write-Host &quot;  ${AcidGreen}âœ“${Reset} $crate built successfully&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     } else {
+         Write-Host &quot;  ${HotPink}âœ—${Reset} $crate build failed&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+         Write-Host $buildOutput
+         exit 1
+     }
+     
+     Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ $buildTime = (Get-Date) - $startTime
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;${AcidGreen}[PHASE 3]${Reset} Build complete!&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;  ${ElectricBlue}â—${Reset} Built crates: $($changedCrates.Count)&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;  ${NeonPurple}â—${Reset} Build time: $([math]::Round($buildTime.TotalSeconds, 2))s&quot; -ForegroundColor Magenta
+ Write-Host &quot;  ${HotPink}â—${Reset} Status: ${AcidGreen}SUCCESS${Reset}&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;${CyberYellow}[NEXT]${Reset} Run installation:&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+ Write-Host &quot;  cargo install --path cli --force&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

# Update test files with default Reasoning parameters
test_files = [
    'codex-rs/core/tests/performance_tests.rs',
    'codex-rs/core/tests/e2e_subagent_tests.rs',
]

pattern = r'AgentRuntime::new\(([^)]+)\)'
replacement = r'AgentRuntime::new(\1, ReasoningEffort::default(), ReasoningSummary::default(), Verbosity::default())'

for file_path in test_files:
    path = Path(file_path)
    if path.exists():
        content = path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')
        # Count matches
        matches = len(re.findall(pattern, content))
        if matches > 0:
            new_content = re.sub(pattern, replacement, content)
            path.write_text(new_content, encoding='utf-8')
            print(f'âœ“ Updated {file_path}: {matches} calls')
        else:
            print(f'- No matches in {file_path}')
    else:
        print(f'âœ— File not found: {file_path}')

<details><summary>Tool use: **command** â€¢ Run command: cd C:\Users\downl\Desktop\codex ; py -3 -c "
import re
from pathlib import Path

# Update CLI files with Config-based Reasoning parameters
cli_files = [
    'codex-rs/cli/src/delegate_cmd.rs',
    'codex-rs/cli/src/parallel_delegate_cmd.rs',
    'codex-rs/cli/src/agent_create_cmd.rs',
]

# More sophisticated pattern that handles multi-line calls
updated_count = 0

for file_path in cli_files:
    path = Path(file_path)
    if not path.exists():
        print(f'âœ— File not found: {file_path}')
        continue
        
    content = path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')
    original = content
    
    # Replace AgentRuntime::new( ... ) with added parameters
    # This is a simple approach - find the pattern and add parameters before the closing paren
    lines = content.split('\n')
    new_lines = []
    in_agent_runtime_new = False
    paren_count = 0
    start_line = -1
    
    for i, line in enumerate(lines):
        if 'AgentRuntime::new(' in line:
            in_agent_runtime_new = True
            start_line = i
            paren_count = line.count('(') - line.count(')')
        elif in_agent_runtime_new:
            paren_count += line.count('(') - line.count(')')
            if paren_count == 0 and ')' in line:
                # Found the end - insert parameters before closing
                # Add the reasoning parameters
                indent = ' ' * (len(line) - len(line.lstrip()))
                new_lines.append(indent + 'config.model_reasoning_effort,')
                new_lines.append(indent + 'config.model_reasoning_summary,')
                new_lines.append(indent + 'config.model_verbosity.unwrap_or_default(),')
                in_agent_runtime_new = False
        
        new_lines.append(line)
    
    new_content = '\n'.join(new_lines)
    
    if new_content != original:
        path.write_text(new_content, encoding='utf-8')
        updated_count += 1
        print(f'âœ“ Updated {file_path}')
    else:
        print(f'- No changes needed in {file_path}')

print(f'\nTotal files updated: {updated_count}')
"</summary>

+         // Natural language preprocessing: convert to slash command if matched
+         let processed_text = if !text.starts_with(&#39;/&#39;) {
+             let parser = NaturalLanguageParser::new();
+             if let Some((command, remaining)) = parser.parse_to_slash_command(&amp;text) {
+                 // Convert natural language to slash command
+                 if remaining.is_empty() {
+                     format!(&quot;/{command}&quot;)
+                 } else {
+                     format!(&quot;/{command} {remaining}&quot;)
+                 }
+             } else {
+                 text
+             }
+         } else {
+             text
+         };
+         
+         self.submit_user_message(processed_text.into());
      }

+ # Differential Build Script for Codex
+ # Builds only changed crates for faster compilation
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;=== CODEX DIFFERENTIAL BUILD ===&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
+ $ErrorActionPreference = &quot;Stop&quot;
+ $repoPath = &quot;C:\Users\downl\Desktop\codex&quot;
+ Set-Location &quot;$repoPath\codex-rs&quot;
+ 
+ $startTime = Get-Date
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;[1/3] Detecting changes...&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+ 
+ # Always build core and CLI for now (safest approach)
+ $cratesToBuild = @(&quot;codex-core&quot;, &quot;codex-cli&quot;)
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;  Will build: $($cratesToBuild -join &#39;, &#39;)&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;[2/3] Building Rust crates...&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ 
+ $buildFailed = $false
+ 
+ foreach ($crate in $cratesToBuild) {
+     Write-Host &quot;  Building $crate...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     
+     $buildOutput = cargo build --release -p $crate 2&gt;&amp;1
+     
+     if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
+         Write-Host &quot;    [OK] $crate&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     } else {
+         Write-Host &quot;    [FAILED] $crate&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+         Write-Host $buildOutput -ForegroundColor Red
+         $buildFailed = $true
+         break
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ if ($buildFailed) {
+     Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+     Write-Host &quot;[ERROR] Build failed!&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+     exit 1
+ }
+ 
+ $buildTime = (Get-Date) - $startTime
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;[3/3] Build complete!&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;  Crates built: $($cratesToBuild.Count)&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;  Build time: $([math]::Round($buildTime.TotalSeconds, 2))s&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+ Write-Host &quot;[NEXT] Install with:&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+ Write-Host &quot;  cargo install --path cli --force&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;&quot;
+

from pathlib import Path
import re

# Fix performance_tests.rs
file_path = Path('codex-rs/core/tests/performance_tests.rs')
content = file_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')

# Add helper function at the top
if 'fn create_test_runtime' not in content:
    # Find imports section
    import_end = content.find('\n\n#[tokio::test]')
    if import_end > 0:
        helper = '''
use codex_core::config::Config;
use codex_core::AuthManager;
use codex_otel::otel_event_manager::OtelEventManager;
use codex_protocol::ConversationId;
use codex_protocol::config_types::{ReasoningEffort, ReasoningSummary, Verbosity};
use std::path::PathBuf;
use std::sync::Arc;

// Test helper
fn create_test_runtime(workspace_dir: PathBuf, budget: usize) -> AgentRuntime {
    let config = Arc::new(Config::load_from_disk_or_default().unwrap());
    let auth_manager = AuthManager::shared(config.codex_home.clone(), false, config.cli_auth_credentials_store_mode);
    let otel_manager = OtelEventManager::new_noop();
    let conversation_id = ConversationId::new();
    
    AgentRuntime::new(
        workspace_dir,
        budget,
        config.clone(),
        Some(Arc::clone(&auth_manager)),
        otel_manager,
        config.model_provider.clone(),
        conversation_id,
        ReasoningEffort::default(),
        ReasoningSummary::default(),
        Verbosity::default(),
    )
}
'''
        content = content[:import_end] + helper + content[import_end:]

# Fix broken AgentRuntime::new calls
patterns = [
    (r'AgentRuntime::new\(temp_dir\.path\(, ReasoningEffort::default\(\), ReasoningSummary::default\(\), Verbosity::default\(\)\)\.to_path_buf\(\), (\d+)\)',
     r'create_test_runtime(temp_dir.path().to_path_buf(), \1)'),
    (r'AgentRuntime::new\(std::env::current_dir\(, ReasoningEffort::default\(\), ReasoningSummary::default\(\), Verbosity::default\(\)\)\?\.\unwrap\(\), (\d+)\)',
     r'create_test_runtime(std::env::current_dir().unwrap(), \1)'),
]

for old, new in patterns:
    content = re.sub(old, new, content)

file_path.write_text(content, encoding='utf-8')
print('âœ“ Fixed performance_tests.rs')
"</summary>

from pathlib import Path
import re

# Fix performance_tests.rs
file_path = Path('codex-rs/core/tests/performance_tests.rs')
content = file_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')

# Add helper function at the top
if 'fn create_test_runtime' not in content:
    # Find imports section
    import_end = content.find('\n\n#[tokio::test]')
    if import_end > 0:
        helper = '''
use codex_core::config::Config;
use codex_core::AuthManager;
use codex_otel::otel_event_manager::OtelEventManager;
use codex_protocol::ConversationId;
use codex_protocol::config_types::{ReasoningEffort, ReasoningSummary, Verbosity};
use std::path::PathBuf;
use std::sync::Arc;

// Test helper
fn create_test_runtime(workspace_dir: PathBuf, budget: usize) -> AgentRuntime {
    let config = Arc::new(Config::load_from_disk_or_default().unwrap());
    let auth_manager = AuthManager::shared(config.codex_home.clone(), false, config.cli_auth_credentials_store_mode);
    let otel_manager = OtelEventManager::new_noop();
    let conversation_id = ConversationId::new();
    
    AgentRuntime::new(
        workspace_dir,
        budget,
        config.clone(),
        Some(Arc::clone(&auth_manager)),
        otel_manager,
        config.model_provider.clone(),
        conversation_id,
        ReasoningEffort::default(),
        ReasoningSummary::default(),
        Verbosity::default(),
    )
}
'''
        content = content[:import_end] + helper + content[import_end:]

# Fix broken AgentRuntime::new calls
patterns = [
    (r'AgentRuntime::new\(temp_dir\.path\(, ReasoningEffort::default\(\), ReasoningSummary::default\(\), Verbosity::default\(\)\)\.to_path_buf\(\), (\d+)\)',
     r'create_test_runtime(temp_dir.path().to_path_buf(), \1)'),
    (r'AgentRuntime::new\(std::env::current_dir\(, ReasoningEffort::default\(\), ReasoningSummary::default\(\), Verbosity::default\(\)\)\?\.\unwrap\(\), (\d+)\)',
     r'create_test_runtime(std::env::current_dir().unwrap(), \1)'),
]

for old, new in patterns:
    content = re.sub(old, new, content)

file_path.write_text(content, encoding='utf-8')
print('âœ“ Fixed performance_tests.rs')
"
```

+   // VR Controllers
+   controller: true,

+   // Hand Trackingï¼ˆQuest Pro, Quest 3ï¼‰
+   hand: true,
+   
+   // AR Anchorsï¼ˆç©ºé–“ã‚¢ãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ¼ï¼‰

+ // VR Sessionç®¡ç†ãƒ•ãƒƒã‚¯
+ export const useVRSession = () =&gt; {
+   const isVR = xrStore.useState((state) =&gt; state.session?.mode === &#39;immersive-vr&#39;)
+   const isAR = xrStore.useState((state) =&gt; state.session?.mode === &#39;immersive-ar&#39;)
+   
+   const enterVR = async () =&gt; {
+     try {
+       await xrStore.enterVR()
+       console.log(&#39;âœ“ Entered VR mode&#39;)
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to enter VR:&#39;, error)
+       throw error
+     }
+   }

+   const enterAR = async () =&gt; {
+     try {
+       await xrStore.enterAR()
+       console.log(&#39;âœ“ Entered AR mode&#39;)
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to enter AR:&#39;, error)
+       throw error
+     }
+   }
+   
+   const exitXR = () =&gt; {
+     xrStore.getState().session?.end()
+     console.log(&#39;âœ“ Exited XR mode&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   return {
+     isVR,
+     isAR,
+     isXR: isVR || isAR,
+     enterVR,
+     enterAR,
+     exitXR,
+   }
+ }

+ // ãƒ‡ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹æ¤œå‡º
+ export const detectXRCapabilities = async () =&gt; {
+   if (!(&#39;xr&#39; in navigator)) {
+     return {
+       vrSupported: false,
+       arSupported: false,
+       deviceName: &#39;Unknown&#39;,
+     }
+   }
+   
+   const vrSupported = await navigator.xr?.isSessionSupported(&#39;immersive-vr&#39;) ?? false
+   const arSupported = await navigator.xr?.isSessionSupported(&#39;immersive-ar&#39;) ?? false
+   
+   // ãƒ‡ãƒã‚¤ã‚¹åæ¨å®šï¼ˆUserAgentè§£æï¼‰
+   const ua = navigator.userAgent
+   let deviceName = &#39;Unknown&#39;
+   
+   if (ua.includes(&#39;Quest&#39;)) {
+     deviceName = &#39;Meta Quest&#39;
+   } else if (ua.includes(&#39;PSVR&#39;)) {
+     deviceName = &#39;PlayStation VR2&#39;
+   } else if (ua.includes(&#39;Vive&#39;)) {
+     deviceName = &#39;HTC Vive&#39;
+   } else if (ua.includes(&#39;Oculus&#39;)) {
+     deviceName = &#39;Oculus&#39;
+   }
+   
+   return {
+     vrSupported,
+     arSupported,
+     deviceName,
+   }
+ }

+ // SceneVR.tsx - VR-optimized Git Visualization
+ // Full WebXR support with hand tracking and teleportation

+ import { Canvas } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;

+ import { Controllers, Hands, XRButton, useXR } from &#39;@react-three/xr&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { Commit3D } from &#39;./Scene3D&#39;
+ import { WebXRProvider, xrStore } from &#39;../vr/WebXRProvider&#39;

+ // Cyberpunk color palette
+ const CYBERPUNK_COLORS = [
+   &#39;#00d4ff&#39;, // Electric Blue
+   &#39;#b84fff&#39;, // Neon Purple
+   &#39;#ff006e&#39;, // Hot Pink
+   &#39;#39ff14&#39;, // Acid Green
+   &#39;#ffff00&#39;, // Cyber Yellow
+   &#39;#ff3131&#39;, // Neon Red
+   &#39;#00ffff&#39;, // Cyan
+   &#39;#ff00ff&#39;, // Magenta
+ ]
+ 
+ const getColorfulCommitColor = (index: number, isSelected: boolean): string =&gt; {
+   if (isSelected) return &#39;#ffffff&#39;
+   return CYBERPUNK_COLORS[index % CYBERPUNK_COLORS.length]
+ }
+ 
+ interface SceneVRProps {
+   commits: Commit3D[]
+   onCommitClick?: (sha: string) =&gt; void
+   selectedCommitSha?: string
+ }
+ 
+ function VRCommitNodes({ commits, onCommitClick, selectedCommitSha }: SceneVRProps) {
+   const meshRef = useRef&lt;THREE.InstancedMesh&gt;(null)
+   const { isPresenting } = useXR()
+   
+   const { matrices, colors } = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const matrices: THREE.Matrix4[] = []
+     const colors: number[] = []
+     
+     commits.forEach((commit, index) =&gt; {
+       const matrix = new THREE.Matrix4()
+       const position = new THREE.Vector3(commit.x, commit.y, commit.z)
+       const isSelected = commit.sha === selectedCommitSha
+       
+       // VRãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã§ã¯å¤§ãã‚ã«è¡¨ç¤º
+       const scale = isPresenting ? (isSelected ? 2.5 : 1.5) : (isSelected ? 1.8 : 1.0)
+       
+       matrix.compose(
+         position,
+         new THREE.Quaternion(),
+         new THREE.Vector3(scale, scale, scale)
+       )
+       matrices.push(matrix)
+       
+       const cyberpunkColor = getColorfulCommitColor(index, isSelected)
+       const color = new THREE.Color(cyberpunkColor)
+       colors.push(color.r, color.g, color.b)
+     })
+     
+     return { matrices, colors }
+   }, [commits, selectedCommitSha, isPresenting])
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (meshRef.current) {
+       matrices.forEach((matrix, i) =&gt; {
+         meshRef.current!.setMatrixAt(i, matrix)
+         meshRef.current!.setColorAt(i, new THREE.Color(
+           colors[i * 3],
+           colors[i * 3 + 1],
+           colors[i * 3 + 2]
+         ))
+       })
+       meshRef.current.instanceMatrix.needsUpdate = true
+       if (meshRef.current.instanceColor) {
+         meshRef.current.instanceColor.needsUpdate = true
+       }
+     }
+   }, [matrices, colors])
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;instancedMesh
+       ref={meshRef}
+       args={[undefined, undefined, commits.length]}
+       onClick={(e) =&gt; {
+         if (e.instanceId !== undefined &amp;&amp; onCommitClick) {
+           onCommitClick(commits[e.instanceId].sha)
+         }
+       }}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.5, 32, 32]} /&gt;
+       &lt;meshStandardMaterial 
+         vertexColors 
+         emissive=&quot;#ffffff&quot;
+         emissiveIntensity={0.2}
+       /&gt;
+     &lt;/instancedMesh&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function VRCommitEdges({ commits }: { commits: Commit3D[] }) {
+   const lines = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const lineObjects: { line: THREE.Line; color: string }[] = []
+     
+     commits.forEach((commit, index) =&gt; {
+       commit.parents.forEach(parentSha =&gt; {
+         const parent = commits.find(c =&gt; c.sha === parentSha)
+         if (parent) {
+           const points = [
+             new THREE.Vector3(commit.x, commit.y, commit.z),
+             new THREE.Vector3(parent.x, parent.y, parent.z)
+           ]
+           const geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry().setFromPoints(points)
+           
+           const edgeColor = CYBERPUNK_COLORS[index % CYBERPUNK_COLORS.length]
+           const material = new THREE.LineBasicMaterial({ 
+             color: new THREE.Color(edgeColor),
+             transparent: true,
+             opacity: 0.7,
+             blending: THREE.AdditiveBlending,
+             linewidth: 2, // VRã§è¦‹ã‚„ã™ã
+           })
+           const line = new THREE.Line(geometry, material)
+           lineObjects.push({ line, color: edgeColor })
+         }
+       })
+     })
+     
+     return lineObjects
+   }, [commits])
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       {lines.map(({ line }, i) =&gt; (
+         &lt;primitive key={i} object={line} /&gt;
+       ))}
+     &lt;/&gt;
+   )
+ }

+ // VRç”¨æƒ…å ±ãƒ‘ãƒãƒ«ï¼ˆ3Dç©ºé–“ã«é…ç½®ï¼‰
+ function VRInfoPanel({ commit }: { commit: Commit3D | null }) {
+   if (!commit) return null
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;group position={[0, 5, -10]}&gt;
+       &lt;Text

+       &gt;
+         SHA: {commit.sha.slice(0, 8)}
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }

+ function VRScene({ commits, onCommitClick, selectedCommitSha }: SceneVRProps) {
+   const [selectedCommit, setSelectedCommit] = useState&lt;Commit3D | null&gt;(null)
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const commit = commits.find(c =&gt; c.sha === selectedCommitSha) ?? null
+     setSelectedCommit(commit)
+   }, [selectedCommitSha, commits])
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;&gt;
+       {/* Lighting for VR */}
+       &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.4} /&gt;

+ function ARReticle() {
+   const reticleRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Mesh&gt;(null)
+   
+   useHitTest((hitMatrix) =&gt; {
+     if (reticleRef.current) {
+       reticleRef.current.visible = true
+       reticleRef.current.matrix.copy(hitMatrix)
+     }
+   })
+   
+   return (
+     &lt;mesh ref={reticleRef} rotation-x={-Math.PI / 2}&gt;
+       &lt;ringGeometry args={[0.1, 0.15, 32]} /&gt;
+       &lt;meshBasicMaterial color=&quot;#00d4ff&quot; transparent opacity={0.7} /&gt;
+     &lt;/mesh&gt;
+   )
+ }

+ // ARç©ºé–“ã«é…ç½®ã•ã‚ŒãŸGitã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ•
+ function ARGitGraph({ commits, onCommitClick }: ARSceneProps) {
+   const [placed, setPlaced] = useState(false)
+   const [anchorPosition, setAnchorPosition] = useState&lt;THREE.Vector3&gt;(new THREE.Vector3())
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+   
+   // Hitãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã§é…ç½®ä½ç½®ã‚’æ±ºå®š
+   useHitTest((hitMatrix) =&gt; {
+     if (!placed) {
+       const position = new THREE.Vector3()
+       position.setFromMatrixPosition(hitMatrix)
+       setAnchorPosition(position)
+     }
+   })
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (groupRef.current &amp;&amp; placed) {
+       groupRef.current.position.copy(anchorPosition)
+     }
+   }, [anchorPosition, placed])
+   
+   // ã‚¿ãƒƒãƒ—ã§é…ç½®
+   const handleTap = () =&gt; {
+     if (!placed) {
+       setPlaced(true)
+     }
+   }
+   
+   return (

+           {commits.map((commit, index) =&gt; {
+             const color = CYBERPUNK_COLORS[index % CYBERPUNK_COLORS.length]
+             
+             return (
+               &lt;group key={commit.sha}&gt;
+                 &lt;mesh
+                   position={[

+                     commit.y * 0.05,
+                     commit.z * 0.05,
+                   ]}

+                   &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.02, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+                   &lt;meshStandardMaterial

+                     emissive={color}

+                   position={[

+

+ // VirtualDesktop Optimizer
+ // Quest Link / Air Link / VirtualDesktop streaming optimization
+ 
+ export interface VDQualityPreset {
+   name: string
+   renderScale: number
+   bloomIntensity: number
+   chromaIntensity: number
+   targetFps: number
+   enablePostProcessing: boolean
+   lodBias: number
+ }
+ 
+ export const VD_PRESETS: Record&lt;string, VDQualityPreset&gt; = {
+   ultra: {
+     name: &#39;Ultra (Local)&#39;,
+     renderScale: 1.5,
+     bloomIntensity: 2.0,
+     chromaIntensity: 0.002,
+     targetFps: 120,
+     enablePostProcessing: true,
+     lodBias: 0,
+   },
+   high: {
+     name: &#39;High (WiFi 6)&#39;,
+     renderScale: 1.2,
+     bloomIntensity: 1.5,
+     chromaIntensity: 0.0015,
+     targetFps: 90,
+     enablePostProcessing: true,
+     lodBias: 0.5,
+   },
+   medium: {
+     name: &#39;Medium (VirtualDesktop)&#39;,
+     renderScale: 1.0,
+     bloomIntensity: 1.0,
+     chromaIntensity: 0.001,
+     targetFps: 72,
+     enablePostProcessing: true,
+     lodBias: 1.0,
+   },
+   low: {
+     name: &#39;Low (Mobile Hotspot)&#39;,
+     renderScale: 0.8,
+     bloomIntensity: 0.5,
+     chromaIntensity: 0,
+     targetFps: 60,
+     enablePostProcessing: false,
+     lodBias: 2.0,
+   },
+ }
+ 
+ export class VirtualDesktopOptimizer {
+   private currentPreset: VDQualityPreset
+   private isVirtualDesktop: boolean = false
+   
+   constructor() {
+     this.currentPreset = VD_PRESETS.medium
+     this.detectVirtualDesktop()
+   }
+   
+   // VirtualDesktopæ¤œå‡º
+   detectVirtualDesktop(): boolean {
+     // UserAgentã‹ã‚‰VDæ¤œå‡ºã‚’è©¦ã¿ã‚‹
+     const ua = navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()
+     
+     // VirtualDesktopç‰¹æœ‰ã®ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼ã‚„UAæ–‡å­—åˆ—
+     this.isVirtualDesktop = 
+       ua.includes(&#39;virtualdesktop&#39;) ||
+       ua.includes(&#39;oculus&#39;) ||
+       ua.includes(&#39;quest&#39;) ||
+       this.checkVDConnection()
+     
+     if (this.isVirtualDesktop) {
+       console.log(&#39;âœ“ VirtualDesktop detected - applying streaming optimizations&#39;)
+       this.applyPreset(&#39;medium&#39;)
+     }
+     
+     return this.isVirtualDesktop
+   }
+   
+   // VDæ¥ç¶šãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼ˆãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ†ãƒ³ã‚·ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ï¼‰
+   private checkVDConnection(): boolean {
+     // Performance APIã§ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ†ãƒ³ã‚·ã‚’ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+     if (!window.performance || !window.performance.getEntriesByType) {
+       return false
+     }
+     
+     const navigation = window.performance.getEntriesByType(&#39;navigation&#39;)[0] as PerformanceNavigationTiming
+     if (navigation) {
+       const latency = navigation.responseStart - navigation.requestStart
+       // 10msä»¥ä¸Šã®ãƒ¬ã‚¤ãƒ†ãƒ³ã‚· = ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°ã®å¯èƒ½æ€§
+       return latency &gt; 10
+     }
+     
+     return false
+   }
+   
+   // ãƒ—ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆé©ç”¨
+   applyPreset(presetName: string): void {
+     const preset = VD_PRESETS[presetName]
+     if (preset) {
+       this.currentPreset = preset
+       console.log(&#96;Applied preset: ${preset.name}&#96;)
+       
+       // DOMã«ãƒ—ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆæƒ…å ±ã‚’ä¿å­˜ï¼ˆReactã‚³ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ãƒˆã‹ã‚‰å‚ç…§å¯èƒ½ï¼‰
+       document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-vd-preset&#39;, presetName)
+       document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-vd-fps&#39;, preset.targetFps.toString())
+       document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-vd-render-scale&#39;, preset.renderScale.toString())
+     }
+   }
+   
+   // ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒ³ã‚°æœ€é©åŒ–é©ç”¨
+   optimizeForStreaming(): void {
+     // ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°è§£åƒåº¦èª¿æ•´
+     this.reduceRenderResolution()
+     
+     // ãƒã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹è»½æ¸›
+     this.reducePostProcessing()
+     
+     // LODç©æ¥µé©ç”¨
+     this.applyAggressiveLOD()
+     
+     // ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯æœ€é©åŒ–
+     this.reduceNetworkLoad()
+   }
+   
+   private reduceRenderResolution(): void {
+     const canvas = document.querySelector(&#39;canvas&#39;)
+     if (canvas) {
+       const scale = this.currentPreset.renderScale
+       canvas.style.imageRendering = scale &lt; 1 ? &#39;pixelated&#39; : &#39;auto&#39;
+     }
+   }
+   
+   private reducePostProcessing(): void {
+     if (!this.currentPreset.enablePostProcessing) {
+       document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-disable-postprocessing&#39;, &#39;true&#39;)
+     }
+   }
+   
+   private applyAggressiveLOD(): void {
+     document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-lod-bias&#39;, this.currentPreset.lodBias.toString())
+   }
+   
+   private reduceNetworkLoad(): void {
+     // Delta updates only
+     // Aggressive caching
+     document.documentElement.setAttribute(&#39;data-cache-aggressive&#39;, &#39;true&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   // FPSæ¸¬å®š
+   measureFPS(): number {
+     let lastTime = performance.now()
+     let frameCount = 0
+     let fps = 0
+     
+     const measure = () =&gt; {
+       frameCount++
+       const currentTime = performance.now()
+       const elapsed = currentTime - lastTime
+       
+       if (elapsed &gt;= 1000) {
+         fps = Math.round((frameCount * 1000) / elapsed)
+         frameCount = 0
+         lastTime = currentTime
+       }
+       
+       requestAnimationFrame(measure)
+     }
+     
+     measure()
+     
+     return fps
+   }
+   
+   // ç¾åœ¨ã®ãƒ—ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆå–å¾—
+   getCurrentPreset(): VDQualityPreset {
+     return this.currentPreset
+   }
+   
+   // VirtualDesktopæ¤œå‡ºçŠ¶æ…‹
+   isUsingVirtualDesktop(): boolean {
+     return this.isVirtualDesktop
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Global singleton
+ export const vdOptimizer = new VirtualDesktopOptimizer()
+ 
+ // React Hook
+ export const useVirtualDesktopOptimizer = () =&gt; {
+   const [preset, setPreset] = useState&lt;VDQualityPreset&gt;(vdOptimizer.getCurrentPreset())
+   const [isVD, setIsVD] = useState(vdOptimizer.isUsingVirtualDesktop())
+   
+   const changePreset = (presetName: string) =&gt; {
+     vdOptimizer.applyPreset(presetName)
+     setPreset(vdOptimizer.getCurrentPreset())
+   }
+   
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const detected = vdOptimizer.detectVirtualDesktop()
+     setIsVD(detected)
+     
+     if (detected) {
+       vdOptimizer.optimizeForStreaming()
+     }
+   }, [])
+   
+   return {
+     preset,
+     isVD,
+     changePreset,
+     availablePresets: Object.keys(VD_PRESETS),
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // CYBERPUNK_COLORSå®šç¾©ï¼ˆARSceneå†…ã§ä½¿ç”¨ï¼‰

+   &#39;#00d4ff&#39;,
+   &#39;#b84fff&#39;,
+   &#39;#ff006e&#39;,
+   &#39;#39ff14&#39;,
+   &#39;#ffff00&#39;,

+   &#39;#00ffff&#39;,
